website_summaries.verdict: Powerful strimmer with boost mode that cuts through thick vegetation like butter.
pros: Turbo and eco modes let you choose power and battery life options

customer_reviews.title: Beware built in obsolescence
customer_reviews.text: I have hid this strimmer for three years and its a great little performer, very useful. However, this morning, mid strim, the head came loose, so I took it apart to see if I could resolve it. The main gear is plastic, running against a metal gear, so this is badly worn. The head was loose because the plastic retaining collar into which it fits runs against a metal bearing and has completely melted away. I would have thought both issues were pretty obviously design flaws and both certain to fail in the long run. At best this is poor product quality, at worst, built in obsolescence. I will not buy one of these again.
customer_reviews.author: isd

customer_reviews.title: 2 Years and 6 months later
customer_reviews.text: 2 Years and 6 months later, strimmer is still going strong, had my reservations that the strimmer would only cut light stuff but was suprised how well it can cope with large weeds. No, it does not perform like a petrol strimmer, but its cordless which makes it easy to work with
customer_reviews.author: Julie Demaret

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: So powerful that a few edges of plants disappeared the first time that I used it. Now I have got used to it and find it does a great job at trimming the lawn edge. I have waited posting a review until I have had it for 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: StanM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent well made product
customer_reviews.text: How I ever managed with a Corded machine I will never know. This is sturdy, efficient, reasonable weight - fine for a Lady. Battery charges so fast and lasts for a long time. Easy "button" light to tell you how much charge you have left. Delighted!
customer_reviews.author: Beaminsterbabe

customer_reviews.title: Would give 6 if I could
customer_reviews.text: Would have given this a 6 if I could. What a beast of a machine. Was a tad dubious that a battery driven brush cutter could do the bizz but oh yeah - no problem. I had 1/3 of an acre of ground elder, grasses 1m tall, nettles, brambles, dandelions etc etc - gone gone gone. Machine just ate it up and spat it out. Needed the turbo power mode so battery lasted about 15-20 minutes but frankly I needed a rest each time anyway. Eco mode will be fine for keeping the place in shape now the hard work is done. Absolutely superb - well done B&D - great piece of kit.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart F. King

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to keep my small allotment plot tidy ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep my small allotment plot tidy. There is some grass growing between the beds and this can grow quite long. REviews have suggested that the strimmer is suitable for such tasks. I have managed to keep the grass and weeds under control quite well with this tool but the battery life is only 10 mins on full power which is needed to cope with the longer grass. The manufacturers state that the tool is designed only for edging for which I imagine it is quite adequate. For tougher jobs a petrol engine powered tool is going to be more suitable and not slow down after 10-15 mins use.
customer_reviews.author: fridge magnet

customer_reviews.title: 36v battery on strimmer
customer_reviews.text: bought last August on Amazon and used three times. when going to use this year the strimmer would not work. placed battery on charger but charger says battery fully charged. pressed battery indication button on back of battery but lights are working. checked battery voltage and it is only 31.5 volts.
customer_reviews.author: william long

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, broke fourth time of using
customer_reviews.text: Strimmer arrived and looked fine, but I was concerned about the cheap, flimsy plastic on the strimmer wire case. Sure enough after it's fourth use the cheap plactic fractured. I spoke to Amazon who immediately offered a full refund so no complaints there, but why do a supposedly reputable firm like Black & Decker cheapen their image with third-rate product materials. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME!
customer_reviews.author: proutie

customer_reviews.title: First class
customer_reviews.text: Possibly the best garden product I have ever bought. The mobility this strimmer provides being cordless is fantastic. No more extension leads and whipping the cable out the way every 30 seconds. The battery lasted my average size front and back gardens with 2 of the 3 bars still available.
customer_reviews.author: G S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and service.
customer_reviews.text: Having taken on a very neglected large garden a year ago I needed a lightweight battery charged strimmer to enable me to reach the whole garden. A petrol one is too heavy and a corded one isn’t even an option here. After a bit of research I decided on this amazing piece of equipment. Ordered Sunday morning, delivered Monday afternoon and garden strimmed with ease by Tuesday evening. Easy to use, very powerful and probably the best piece of gardening equipment I now own. Excellent service from seller too. Thoroughly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jastevina

customer_reviews.title: Terrific.
customer_reviews.text: This arrived the day after buying it! Terrific service. By the time I'd assembled it (very easy) the battery was charged and I was off strimming. I have a large garden with some wild areas, now out of control, for which I used it on turbo and it was fantastic - lasted as long as I needed, cutting through long grass, nettles docks and small brambles. I used to have a petrol strimmer, but am a woman in my 70s and was finding it too heavy - this is perfect and does everything I did before with the exception of heavy brambles. Really thrilled with it.
customer_reviews.author: Manumit

customer_reviews.title: Cordless convenience
customer_reviews.text: Like : Cordless, lightweight, easy to use, charge lasts a reasonable long time. Fast charging Li-on battery is a plus factor. Dislikes: Catchy, somewhat rough Press In operator safety button on either side. Could be much better! Also the strimmer head angle should be more adjustable: ex: 30, 45 degrees. The main minus thing though is the handle safety button. It also requires that the battery power pack is given a hard tap to make sure it is secured and clicked into place on the end of the handle otherwise it can fall out. Cannot comment on the long term reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Athlestan

customer_reviews.title: Great machine!
customer_reviews.text: This strimmer is an identical replacement for my old one which did six years of hard labour! I managed to assemble it on my own very quickly. It's quite comfortable to use as there is good height adjustment and it is well-balanced. I don't find it too heavy. The power level is adjustable and I find at medium level it will go for about half an hour. It will deal with grass of almost any length through to thistles. The battery charger is easy to use and it only seems to take a couple of hours to recharge.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic bit of kit
customer_reviews.text: I was sceptical that a battery powered strimmer could be any good, but having a large garden I didn’t want the hassle of a loooong extension lead and petrol ones were just gonna be too heavy. Wow! 40+ minutes on full turbo power and it hacks through all but the woodiest of weed. Foxglove, nettles, brambles, vine weed, ivy, all turned to dust. I’ve not actually managed to run out of battery before completing the garden. Seriously impressive, and feels solid too.
customer_reviews.author: frankfish

customer_reviews.title: Best Strimmer Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is easily the best strimmer I have purchased. It is lightweight, powerful and really effective with a range of power settings and has battery lasting circa 1 hour.. Unfortunately it suddenly ceased working after 11 months after very heavy use. Black and Decker replaced it. A word of warning B&D service centres are few far between, so this in evolved a lot of travel! When in use the strimmer works perfectly and does not encounter the perennial problem of the trimmer cable cutting and having to be re-spooled. In this respect the product is simply brilliant. Despite the fault above I would re-purchase as it is my only stammer that has really worked!
customer_reviews.author: SUSAN DALY

customer_reviews.title: LIBERATION
customer_reviews.text: I was fed-up with the blasted cable of my old unit, oh yes and the 'sliced' cable episode, but that is another story. Great packaging, all put together with ease, charged up the (ONE) battery supplied with the charger also supplied, and put it to work.. Worked very well, BUT only after a few weeks of use the age old issue of the 'Auto-Feed' function not working, and having to stop battery out, take out cable cassette, re-twine, and start again. Why ol' Why cannot B&D design a feed system that is robust, making a good product into an Excellent one.
customer_reviews.author: NIgel

customer_reviews.title: Great little piece of kit - with a telescopic handle
customer_reviews.text: Really please with this as it has the power to do all my edging and it recharges really quickly. In fact because it is cordless I now finish the mowing and edge the grass as I don’t have to get out lots of electric cable and extension leads - hassle free! Another good point for me is the telescopic handle, I can keep it compact as I am only 5.2 so much easier to use. All in all - very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Cordless Black & Decker 36V Lithium Ion strimmer
customer_reviews.text: The item was delayed in transit and I arranged to have it delivered on the Monday rather than the weekend as the office is closed. It duly arrived on the day I had requested and although the original box was damaged and taped up, the strimmer was in very good condition, no signs of wear or otherwise. I put it together in a jiffy and will be using it this weekend no doubt. It feels sturdy but light and the battery was charged up already when it was delivered. As the handle is adjustable, there is no reason to use it in a uncomfortable position when strimming.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Cema

customer_reviews.title: Good strimmer but beware battery size is changing.
customer_reviews.text: much improved from the old 36v brushless strimmer which burnt out many times. There has an easy to access eco dial which helps save battery usage and the battery is now at an angle so you no longer hit it with your elbow and unclip it as you strim. The big drawback with this model is that B&D have now changed from 18v/36v batteries to 20v/40v which means the whole point of one battery fits all no longer applies. I wanted to buy a hedge trimmer as I already have 2 36v batteries but new hedge cutters are 40v or I have to buy old discontinued stock which Amazon are still selling.
customer_reviews.author: J.Benson

customer_reviews.title: ... this on the strength of the reviews - works pretty well. Battery charges quickly and seems to last ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on the strength of the reviews - works pretty well. Battery charges quickly and seems to last a good while. Light enough. Works well in our medium size garden. Not sure how well it'd work in a tough envirnoment, but for trimming the sides of stuff, its good. The minus point for us is the edge trimmer...its just a bit of metal, cant really get it to work in any useful way. Maybe need more practice but there's no instruction or anything useful. So yeah, pretty happy but edging tool could do with improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: its great but the battery apparatus is real a problem
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little machine for light strimming. Its the battery that causes the problem - its fragile, a bit broke off. It is not easy to change and the charger is utterly hopeless. If it flashes red its not working - you have to push all the moveable bits on the battery till the charger is happy THEN it works, that can take quite a bit of coaxing. I'm probably beyond any guarantee - bought last year - so point in complaining. However, unless they fix the battery apparatus I honestly wouldn't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: achaidh

customer_reviews.title: A Cut Above....
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic little strimmer. Light, agile , robust & a nice balanced strimmer. Cuts effortlessly, even the tougher stuff doesn't stop it in its tracks. I use it only on turbo and it lasts approx 15mins on continual use. Charges fully in around 30mins and your ready to go again. 15mins might not sound very long but it cuts very fast and effortlessly and so you can cut a fair bit of grass in that time. The auto line feed is brilliant and one spool will last a long time..... Highly recommended 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Jason Dunlop

customer_reviews.title: Won't last more than 3years, plastic gears
customer_reviews.text: I've loved my trimmer for 3 years but it's stopped working and I've taken it apart to try and fix it. Turns out that the main gear is made of plastic as well as the casing. They are borh damaged. The gear has lostmmany teethaand tthe ccasing has been worn down. I can't replace the gear as it can't be taken apart from the bearing etc... At that price I was expecting better quality than plastic gear and casing. wworn down
customer_reviews.author: E.B

customer_reviews.title: Won't Last Buy Something Else - Anything Except This
customer_reviews.text: Bought on Amazon and used no more than three times. when going to use this year the strimmer would not work. placed battery on charge but charger blinking a red light. When I pressed battery indication button on back of battery only one led light came on. checked battery voltage and it is only 31.5 volts. It appears the battery pack is hit and miss, lost my money and binned It. BUY SOMETHING ELSE. Black & Decker are not what they use to be.
customer_reviews.author: Timhaggler

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm very happy with my purchase, and pleasantly impressed. One of the most important things for me was that it wasn't to noisy, and I think using the machine on the eco veritable speed setting it's within reasonable limits. It's made of quite robust plastic and a adjustable aluminium shaft. Up till now I can tidy up my whole garden using it on the eco setting on one charge and still have some in reserve. It's a petty it doesn't have two outlets on the spool for the nylon cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Mr CJ

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Faffing around with noisy petrol strimmer was not for me. I wondered if a cordless would have the power. If it's on turbo it does and if you plan a bit, the relatively short battery life on turbo can be compensated for. So, light, no flipping cables, no flipping petrol to spill, and no nasty niffs or neighbour infuriating noises. Good buy, but will see what reliability like in a couple of years. Bright colour means even I struggle to loose it in the undergrowth.
customer_reviews.author: D. Nicholls

customer_reviews.title: Geat Strimmer
customer_reviews.text: After returning a battery strimmer to a well known store I decided to purchase the Black & Decker 36V. I realised immediately on first use, how good this is to use. Powerful with adjustable speed control to save battery & give extra power when needed & gives the lawn edging a professional cut. The cord thankfully self adjusts (this was the problem with the previous strimmer that was replaced but still jammed). It's such a pleasure to use. Not cheap but if its what you need, you will be pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Martyn

customer_reviews.title: Terrific buy.
customer_reviews.text: Say farewell to petrol. This strimmer is really good and tackles some very rough overgrown weeds with ease. It is light, manoeverable and powerful. No more struggling to get started, no more fooling around with the strimmer line, no more noise. And after 30 to 40 minutes hard work in which you cover a LOT of ground you get an automatic tea break while the battery recharges. Best buy. PS Dont bother with the 18v version, its the 36 volts that give this one the guts.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J. G. C. Sansbury

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine - buy it
customer_reviews.text: I love this strimmer. Previously I had a Bosch one but it was old and needed replaced so I read loads of reviews and chose this one albeit I didn't really rate Black and Decker as a make. I am so glad I did. it charges quickly, the power (I have been on the eco setting) is amazing. The telescopic handle means you can get a comfortable fit and it cuts through anything. A joy to use and an excellent buy so thanks to all who posted reviews before me. Update - 2 years later it is broken & just out of guarantee. It was great while it worked
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Battery won't charge up after a few goes.
customer_reviews.text: Strimmer worked great tge few times I've used it but unfortunately the battery has gone and won't charge. Only want a replacement battery but can't seem to get hold of anyone to fix the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: My first strimmer and I found it easy to assemble and use. I will admit to probably using it more for weed cutting rather than grass as I have some uncultivated areas to keep low. On Turbo it is a bit of a beast and generally Eco is ok. Once I had cleared the area it is easy to maintain on Eco. The constant line feed is great and the battery charges quickly enough. Time for a cold drink before going out in the hot sun again.
customer_reviews.author: Nunu

customer_reviews.title: Died after 4 years: used maybe 4 hours/year
customer_reviews.text: It was great while it lasted but this morning it gave out a high-pitched whine and the head stopped spinning. I took it apart to see if it was repairable and found the plastic(!) retainer for the bottom bearing had disappeared (worn away) allowing the head to drop down, disengaging the drive cog from the motor cog. Not a very durable design!
customer_reviews.author: cwcltd

customer_reviews.title: A very good strimmer
customer_reviews.text: I had an old petrol strimmer which started to give trouble starting which caused a lot of grief. I said I’d try an electric strimmer so I’m pleasantly surprised that this strimmer has the power and battery life to handle everything my petrol strimmer did previously. The strimmer is so easy and lightweight to use for the first time I was able to lend it to my father to use in his garden I like the petrol strimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Goof lightweight battery strimmer.
customer_reviews.text: Used to replace a heavier B&D strimmer that had lost a couple of bolts. It’s a great strimmer for smaller gardens - lightweight but powerful enough for some heavier rough (has a turbo setting if needed). Battery is also lightweight and easily sufficient for my small gardens. I haven’t need to change the cutting wire yet after about ten uses but I hope it’s not as tricky as the previous B&D was!
customer_reviews.author: JohnT

customer_reviews.title: Essential kit for anyone with longer grass and/or tricky corners/grass banks.
customer_reviews.text: Essential kit for me - meadow, tricky corners, under trees, cutting grass banks....this gets almost daily use. Just one note - when changing the strimmer reel, don’t drop and lose the little widget. It pushes the strimmer wire through. Or the spring that holds the reel in place. Easily done.
customer_reviews.author: Trish Beswick

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use efficient strimmer.
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to set up and I enjoy using it. It charges very fast allowing just the right time for a break. It is very easy to change from light grass mode to harder wear at the flick of a button. It is slightly heavier than I anticipated but that hasn't stopped me so far. It is also easier to transport and compacts fast to pop in the car. Delighted with my purchase problem is my partner also likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Gillian claire osborne

customer_reviews.title: No Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This is a mean machine. Incredibly powerful, it will dig trenches in your lawn if you let it... Battery life is streets ahead of my last strimmer, but the assembled machine weights ton. It could use a support strap round the shoulders to allow better guidance when trimming lawn edges. Or I need to do weight training. Choose this strimmer if you have tough jobs to handle. Or long ones.
customer_reviews.author: Logos

customer_reviews.title: Changed my attitude towards gardening
customer_reviews.text: I hate mowing the lawn. And weeding. My 25 SqM garden rapidly becomes wilderness. Until this strimmer entered my life ! This thing is fun. And powerful. I threw out the lawn mower too. The lawn and borders look immaculate now. Spend the extra & go cordless. You’ll find yourself using it more frequently. The garden will look inviting and your partner will be much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Superb. Buy one!!
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant. Was a bit hesitant as I’ve got a sizeable garden with lots of lawn edges. I need not have worried as this strimmer is more than up to the task. I’ve only ever used it of eco mode, so the battery lasts for ages and the auto feed for the strummer line, means that you never have to stop to reload. I use this first, leaving the strimmed grass in the lawn, then cut the grass with my new mulching battery lawnmower. Should have done this years ago. Now look forward to grass cutting/strimming! Just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: ROBIN KNOX

customer_reviews.title: I find both are the best of their type (included corded) I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I bought this along with the hedge trimmer GTC36552PC-GB: I find both are the best of their type (included corded) I have ever owned. As both use the same battery, I have in effect a spare battery.The battery lasts a very long time, certainly easily enough for me. The only downside is the self spooling mechanism in the strimmer: it goes thro' a spool after about two battery uses - will end up expensive so I bought a large spool (B&D, same diameter of cord but casing not compatible) and rewound the existing spool. Does now not always self spool but no great deal. I would thoroughly recommend both.
customer_reviews.author: McSkelley

customer_reviews.title: Best battery powered strimmer by far
customer_reviews.text: I was dubious about this as I've had battery powered strimmers before that have been underpowered. This was recommended to me and was my last throw of the dice before going petrol operated. It's a great product. Really easy to put together and packs a really good punch. Smashed through tall weeds no problem and gives a good hour of hard strimming in full power before a recharge is needed. No issues at all with the line feed. If you want to be time efficient then get a second battery, as it takes an hour to recharge. Overall a great bit of kit for the money, and by far the best battery strimmer I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Mookie

customer_reviews.title: POWERFUL
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. It has an adjustable power control - I find eco is enough for my purpose. The handle can be adjusted to suit your height. I also has a handle pull out support when you are edging the lawn and a rotating head. Early days but impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant cordless strimmer so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Honestly my garden was like a jungle so overgrown as my son had broke my mower I have a large back garden and I hate cables I needed something powerful enough to get through it and this delivers it’s quite expensive but I think I’d rather pay more for a product that does the job well it lasts roughly 20 minutes but you can get a lot done in that time because it’s powerful enough yes I’d recommend it to anyone looking for a cordless strimmer hopefully it will last
customer_reviews.author: Sue Leyland

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 18 months of average use
customer_reviews.text: The strimmer was light and less noisy than others, but lacks solidity and durability - much of it is plastic, hence the light weight. After 18 months the spindle mechanism broke - and that was the end of it, as it no longer spun. Very dissappointed but not that surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Assad Felya

customer_reviews.title: Like it - a lot!
customer_reviews.text: "You won't be disappointed" as one nice gentleman said when answering a question I asked. He was right! I'm 5' 3" and the fact it is height adjustable is brilliant. I found it so easy to put together, the battery charged within 30 mins and off into the garden I went. The eco selection was perfect for grass, power it up and it tackled the nettles without a problem. It is light, which is an added bonus. Plus, having two young children, I really love the fact you can take the battery off and take it away from the strimmer, making it completely safe.
customer_reviews.author: MummyC

customer_reviews.title: Feeble
customer_reviews.text: Bought in April. Now mid July and broken. In the head is a series of plastic guides ensuring the cogs mesh. The plastic has eroded so the head no longer rotates. In fairness I have used it extensively in fairly dense growth. As a lawn strimmer it's probably fine. But for harder work it doesn't have the durability. As I took it apart I probably can't return it.
customer_reviews.author: MA Sims

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant time saver.
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant. Love this strimmer. No cables to worry about or having to mix 2 stroke fuel etc. Massive time saver. Will not strimmer full garden on one charge but easily worked around by clearing up clippings when charge runs out and it will be recharged enough in 30 minutes to finish what used to be a pain in the proverbial. Thoroughly enjoy tidying grass verges now. Not worth buying a second battery when it charges so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: graeme

customer_reviews.title: ... dubious as to whether this was going to be easy to use and
customer_reviews.text: Having had a cordless strimmer before I was very dubious as to whether this was going to be easy to use and, more importantly, was the battery going to charge up in a reasonable time and then hold the charge (the bane of my life with cordless tools). Well, I have had this for some months now and given it a lot of heavy use in a fairly large garden. I have to say it has exceeded my expectations and would highly recommend it. It is simple to use, is not too heavy and wearing on the arms and it does hold its charge well and has continued to do so.
customer_reviews.author: M79

customer_reviews.title: although the smaller bamboo was strimmed nicely. I tend to use it in short bursts ...
customer_reviews.text: As far as I am concerned this is the strimmer I always wanted, no mains lead but plenty of power. I use it to cut back weeds and tall grasses which it does with ease. It could not cut through thicker bamboo stumps but I was not really expecting it to, although the smaller bamboo was strimmed nicely. I tend to use it in short bursts but the battery has lasted well as far as I am concerned and is well charged days after I have charged it. The unit is well balanced and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Gadgetman

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is wonderful. I bought this after my petrol strimmer packed up. I had always had trouble starting it and didn't want to repeat my mistake. This is easily as powerful and much more controllable. The adjustable power is great and does most jobs on the eco setting. Have tried on all sorts of stuff from grass to brush and it never lets me down. Also like the fact that the head can be turned over to do lawn edging.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent strimmer.
customer_reviews.text: After years of wrestling with cables then difficult to start petrol strimmers I thought I’d give this a go, we live on a 1/2 acre plot with fields all around, this does the job fantastically well on one charge and the string seems to last forever, no more faffing about when the line breaks, I actually bought a pack of 8 spare cartridges of line but after 3 months of use they remain in the box they came in.
customer_reviews.author: BM

customer_reviews.title: Short lived
customer_reviews.text: I love this strimmer, but this is the second one that's not lasted any time. I bought mine in May 2019 and now in June 19 it's died completely. Considering that it gets used for only a few months in the year, that's very poor value for money!
customer_reviews.author: Bryony N

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job.
customer_reviews.text: We used to have a strimmer with plastic strimmer blades, this one has the cord and it's fantastic. The cord never seems to break and the battery charge lasts ages compared to our last strimmer. Weight wise it's OK, about average( same as our last one). Would definitely recommend this product, very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: tracey

customer_reviews.title: Easy and light to use
customer_reviews.text: Works great, pity the batteries are so expensive as it doens't last long enough to do the whole allotment, but we have learnt to accept this and come back and finish another day. A second battery would help out, but not that essential. We have been using it for several months now and the spool of cord has not run out yet, despite heavy duty work.
customer_reviews.author: Herald Armer

customer_reviews.title: Finally a strimmer which actually works as promised
customer_reviews.text: I've had a variety of corded strimmers which either fail to cut through anything thicker than grass or have 'auto-feed' systems which blatantly don't work. This one, albeit an expensive investment, has consistently trimmed back long grass, brambles and weeds and only once snapped the cord which was easily rectified. For the worst growth, I've been using the maximum power setting which only gives you about 20 minutes cutting time. But it's only around 2 hours for a recharge so you're not waiting ages to start again. Worth the money if you have more than just grass to clear.
customer_reviews.author: SpatterjayHooper

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight strimmer!
customer_reviews.text: Love this strimmer! It's light weight and the battery last ages! It's made strimming the garden so much quicker. I have it on a setting between echo and turbo about half way and I can trim my large garden about three times before I need to charge. Had to look on the box picture to work out how the assemble it correctly!
customer_reviews.author: Deepak K. Sharma

customer_reviews.title: A good deal, with a good deal of power. Happy Customer.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this. It's a medium duty strimmer for domestic gardens. But it's totally brilliant for the cord which just keeps working without snapping... I garden professionally - so the battery matches across the range. Handy having 2. Can recommend the hedge clippers too... As other reviews have stated - you'll get 20 mins or less on turbo setting, 30-40 on the lowest Eco setting. I'm delighted with it. It requires some respect - it's not that rugged in construction - but treat it right and it'll serve you well.
customer_reviews.author: Tom France

customer_reviews.title: Beware of bits of flying strimmer wire
customer_reviews.text: The strimmer itself and battery are, so far, working well. However, the spool that has the strimmer wire on it unravels itself after a couple of metres of the wire having been used. Once it starts to unravel, it gets stuck and doesn't auto-feed and it is impossible to rewind it as tightly as when first used. Once you get to the last few metres of the wire, it comes out at a rate of knots and bits of it come flying off, hitting the legs and arms. I have cuts and welts on my shins as a result of the wire debris that have hit me and it is flippin' painful and quite dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn McBride

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable, buy something else
customer_reviews.text: Bought one last year, used 6-7 times, seemed ok. After a couple of uses this year, cut out and completely stopped. Battery fully charged but trimmer dead. Within warranty so Amazon replaced it with no quibbles. Replacement arrives. Used once. Failed with the same issue. Absolute rubbish. Have requested a full refund to get something fit for purpose. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best things I’ve ever bought
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing. It’s everything the average strimmer isn’t. It’s self explanatory to setup. The whole cable-free thing is so liberating. The self-feeding ‘blade’ is perhaps the best bit of all. The aluminium shaft feels like pure quality. I just got it today, and if in a few months or years I need to tone down my enthusiasm, I will, but somehow I don’t think that’s likely. Well done Black+Decker - great product design.
customer_reviews.author: Daz C

customer_reviews.title: A very useful tool
customer_reviews.text: I have a grass paddock at the back of my house and was looking for a strimmer to use around the hedge bottom to cut back some docks, nettles and briars and saw this one, which I bought because it was 36 volt. It has proved to be an excellent tool and gives me 30 minutes cutting between charges. It also charges a flat battery to full in around an hour, which is useful. It is also very easy to adjust and fairly light to carry and use, but at the same time quite rugged. I also like the auto reel feed. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: I. White

customer_reviews.title: Powerful machine that does the job
customer_reviews.text: I am a female pensioner and was a bit worried that I would not be able to handle it but it is easy and really does a good job. My hands are arthritic so it was important that it was lightweight for me to use. It is fairly lightweight but not as light as I would have liked so can only use in short bursts. It has coped with everything in the garden so far so I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ann shea

customer_reviews.title: Excellent so far
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as our gtech that we bought last year was not up to our garden. This is lightweight has a long lasting lithium battery and has a boost that does the nettles behind our fence. Does edges with ease and the swivel head change works well
customer_reviews.author: Del

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cordless strimmer
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good cordless strimmer with an excellent battery life. Eco mode is good for general use and is adjustable to turbo mode for cutting through brambles etc. How did I manage without this. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DJT

customer_reviews.title: At least 30 minutes run time in Eco mode.
customer_reviews.text: As you can see I have a pretty large front garden to manage. 😊 This baby is brilliant. It is light and easy to handle and most importantly it lasts the distance. With the speed control toggle you can keep it going longer with eco mode and then switch up when needed. I have a Stihl brush cutter for serious stuff but it is hardly needed now. Buy it it’s great. Oh and I’m über Critical normally - but credit where it’s due.
customer_reviews.author: SecretSpy

customer_reviews.title: Well done Black and Decker!
customer_reviews.text: I have now had this strimmer for a year, and love it. I am nearly 70, but find it easy to use. It recharges very quickly, and is ideal for my 1.5 acre garden for clearing under trees, along fence lines, and edging borders. The old petrol strimmer has gone to the skip, and the petrol chain saw is about to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Jemsa

customer_reviews.title: because they seem to get such poor reviews. I am happily changing my view
customer_reviews.text: I was very dubious of buying a cordless anything, because they seem to get such poor reviews. I am happily changing my view, this 36v Cordless Blk and Dkr Strimmer is great. Great for the Allotment and for Edging my Lawns. Light and easy to put together and quick and easy to adjust. I think the Lithium Batteries are the way forward. I have not even used it on Turbo yet and it seems to cut fine and lasts at least 1 hour. By the way you can fully charge it in about 20mins. I am really pleased with this so far.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Davies

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Being of a certain age I Put off playing with this machine. Stupid! It saves hours on hands and knees with a carving knife along flagged edges of a large lawn. The battery lasts as long as my arms do and re charges quickly. Cannot recommend this highly enough for any age group.
customer_reviews.author: Salvoice

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very light and manoeuvrable, having no electric cable to avoid and trail around the garden is bliss. Battery lasts long enough (over half an hour of continuous use) and recharges really quickly. Powerful enough for short and long grass, have not tried on deep undergrowth. How the automatic line feed works I have no idea, but it does work and very efficiently too. For my use it is excellent, as to longevity, not long enough to say, however no evident reason to be worried
customer_reviews.author: MRS SALLY JONES

customer_reviews.title: ... quick/small jobs but have found that I use it pretty much all of the time as I haven't come ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a petrol strimmer which is heavy and a bit of a faff to use so I bought this to do quick/small jobs but have found that I use it pretty much all of the time as I haven't come across any jobs that it cant handle! It's light, well made and easy to use and the feature that enables you to rotate the cutting head to do borders is really useful. The battery life is good especially if you regulate the power according to the conditions. Overall I'm very pleased with it and will probably order a second battery to get through some of the bigger jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with a B&D product really
customer_reviews.text: We've used this a few times now and had no issues so far. It does exactly what is expected of it without drama. The battery life is good and it's easy enough to clean and store. It's comfortable to hold and not too heavy. Not sure how easy it will be to change the cutting wire as we haven't got to that stage yet but I would recommend this product based on our experience so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strimming Pleasure
customer_reviews.text: after reading all the reviews I decided to order this strimmer ,and I am not disappointed . the strimmer is a pleasure to use as i am only 6` 6" tall,its a lot quieter than my petrol strimmer. I have used this new strimmer today to cut the grass around my beehives ,not a murmer from the bees, not like when i have used a well known brand of petrol strimmer where i have to be very careful. reading the instructions is a bit like trying to read the instructions for a well known flat pack furniture company, i would have thought better of B&D
customer_reviews.author: Tiny

customer_reviews.title: Cuts as it should
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to strim an overgrown ditch. Handled it very well with setting on 'Eco'. 30 mins use only used 'one led' indication on battery. Cutting line feeds as it should automatically. Only drawback I found was it was a little heavy on the arms after about 15 mins or so and could do with a shoulder strap. Apart from this, the strimmer worked very well indeed.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyG

customer_reviews.title: POWERFUL, YET LIGHTWEIGHT
customer_reviews.text: I BOUGHT THIS TO CLEAR NETTLES FROM MY ACRE FIELD, AND TO STRIM GRASS FROM UNDER MY ELECTRIC FENCE. MY 18 v ONE JUST WASN'T UP TO THE JOB, BUT THIS ONE IS FANTASTIC! LIGHT WEIGHT, AND ALSO HEIGHT ADJUSTABLE. IT HAS PLENTY OF POWER, AND THE BATTERY HADN'T RUN OUT BEFORE I WAS FINISHED. I HAVEN'T CHANGED THE STRIMMER LINE YET, BUT HOPING THAT WILL BE EASY. I WILL UPDATE THIS REVIEW NEXT YEAR.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Great cordless garden strimmer
customer_reviews.text: This Black and Decker cordless strimmer is possibly the best garden tool I have ever bought. It is light weight unlike petrol strimmers and nice and quiet. It has lots of power and strimms just as good as the petrol ones I had. The guide attachment is good and let’s me strimm up to trees and fences easily. Battery lasts a good while and does all my large garden. I was going to purchase a second battery but didn’t need to as the battery charges really quickly. I just love using it and have no hesitation in recommending it.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Husband is very happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for our large garden and he loves it. Tells all his friends how great it is! Can do the full garden and then some with half the battery remaining. And we have a very large garden. He also has enough battery to do the roadside. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Kearney

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of capability but thirsty for power!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to strim new allotment of long grass, weeds and brambles etc. Easy to assemble and use and quite efficient in turbo mode. Relatively short battery life of around 20 minutes per charge, so extra batteries needed for one of my average working sessions! Also uses strimmer line fairly quickly in turbo mode, so spare spools would be handy!
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Light and powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is a great piece of kit.surprisingly powerful and battery life is excellent. I am using it much more than expected because it is so light and quick and easy to use. Stick the battery in and away you go.
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM T.

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: I have quite a large garden and because I hate the hassle of extension leads and cables made the mistake of buying a Bosch cordless strimmer which proved to be totally inadequate for the job. So I was a little skeptical about buying this but needn't have worried. It cuts through thick stemmed grasses and nettles without a second thought and despite heavy use I've yet to have to break off to recharge the battery. It's light, well balanced, a doddle to use and appears well put together. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: M Norman

customer_reviews.title: Good Strimmer with a couple of problems
customer_reviews.text: Good strimmer - plenty of power for my large garden and it's great not to have to connect all the electricity cables. Battery is fine to do edging etc over whole garden in one charge. I have two problems (which may be just me). First it's hard to guide the strimmer exactly where you need it and the automatic line feed doesn't work well/at all. Now had it for much of summer. It's a great tool but the automatic line feed just doesn't work and that's very irritating
customer_reviews.author: Tony G

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 62 yr old woman that works on a caravan park..I didn't know wether this strimmer would cope but I have to say it's amazingly tough..I use it two to three hours on grass and it does it with ease..it's light in weight and the battery lasts almost an hour on eco..I bought a second battery. Worth every penny love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A versatile light strimmer.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this strimmer, light and easy to use. It is powerful enough to cope with all I have challenged it with. I use it around the difficult regions of the garden. I take it to my allotment to basically use it as a mini lawn mower to cut thr boarder paths around the allotment, nothing else would do the job as well. No doubt I will come across a job that will use all its battery capacity but haven't had that problem yet. Charging time is reasonable anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: As a strimmer phobe who has bought petrol and plug in strimmers which have been unsatisfactory in numerous ways. This is superb. Works brilliantly , efficiently and has enabled me to reach and repair livestock fences , now easily access vege and fruit plots amongst other merely beautifying jobs. Best gardening tool I ve ever bought. It charges very quickly, so if I wish to strim on higher power for longer , two charge up batteries would do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Sibylla

customer_reviews.title: Good thing to have.
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my two allotment plots. It is robust enough to feel comfortable for use in walking areas and where occasionally I need to use the Max strength to strim overgrown areas. I thoroughly recommend this strimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Collins

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a petrol strimmer. It is so much better in every way. Smaller, lighter, easy to start, quiet...what is not to like. The best thing is, when I want to use it I get it from the garage, press the button and I am off. No messing with petrol cans, starters and ear defenders. Love it, and use it so much more frequently because of the accessibility
customer_reviews.author: Mike Stoneham

customer_reviews.title: This strimmer is easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I've always used petrol strimmers in the past but got fed up with all the faff with mixing petrol, starting the beast and having to wear a harness just to cart the thing around. Now it a simple process - charge the battery and go. This strimmer is easy to assemble, easy to start and, as a side benefit, no real maintenance to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: David Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Really pleased with this.
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure prior to purchasing if a battery power strimmer would be up to the job, but have been really pleased with this so far. It has coped with quite thick grass/weeds at the allotment and has plenty of battery left. Was easy to assemble and use.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Fannon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the job
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the job! Fast delivery, easy to assemble, powerful fast-charging batteries, long-lasting spool, smooth handling, needs shoulder strap (used two of my old belts). Cut 1.5 acre of very seriously overgrown paddock, wooded grounds and edged the garden neatly by myself - I'm 66 yrs old - in 3 days working 6 hrs/day. Saved minimum GBP350 in gardner's fees. Will buy the same if/when this one expires. K Amiri 1st July 2016.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easiest 5 Stars yet
customer_reviews.text: Um'd and ah'd for ages whether to get this, or just carry on with my electric cabled strummer. Well, can now say I wish now I had bought this sooner! This is an awesome bit of kit. Has made strumming and edging so much easier. Its light and powerful. I have quite a sizeable front and back garden, this did it in Econ mode with no problem. Forgetting the fact it is cordless, as strimmwrs go, this is more like a petrol designed one than electric. Black and Decker really have created a winner here. Well worth the 5 stars. Get yourself one, you wont regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Kingfisher

customer_reviews.title: This is the best strimmer I have had and we use it to ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this having seen someone cutting grass at the cemetery with one. I used to take my petrol strimmer but it was bulky to carry. This is the best strimmer I have had and we use it to do the strimming in the garden now as well as taking it to the cemetery. Battery does not last all that long (1 hour max) but it charges up quickly. So it is ready to use again after a coffee and a biscuit. I haven't used the petrol strimmer since I bought this. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M. F. Webb

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: The strimmer is powerful, well balanced and tackles thick long grass and thick stemmed weeds. The battery charges very quickly, so there is time for a quick coffee and off to go again. Very pleased with the purchase, a well made product which I can highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: I have used this a number of times since purchase and it has certainly helped me tidy up the garden. Assembly was straightforward and adjustment of the height is easy. As I have not had a strimmer for years there was a lot of work to be done and I used up a spool very quickly, but fitting the new one was simple. The battery life is not brilliant, perhaps half an hour but to be honest by then I could do with a break. Overall pleased not to have wires trailing around or a motor to maintain and would therefore recommend
customer_reviews.author: Gazpod

customer_reviews.title: Strong trimmer, but failed battery
customer_reviews.text: Functionally very good, powerful with a long charge. However battery (or charger) failed after winter storage, only nine months after purchase. Just sending them back for replacement; friendly semi-local service centre. I'm concerned that this may recur if there is a quality issue with the batteries. We'll see. Don't think much of the so-called auto-feed, so far.
customer_reviews.author: Pteropus II

customer_reviews.title: Good strimmer
customer_reviews.text: The edge cutting guide is weird. When you get it in position (a bit of a struggle) you can't see it so it is difficult to use. Not very good. However the strimmer is very good other wise. Good battery life and excellent cord feedsystem that works, hooray!
customer_reviews.author: A. B. Dench

customer_reviews.title: Excellent strimmer, exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot more expensive that a corded strimmer and probably a lot less powerful, however it is perfect for my needs. I was fed up with a corded one for obvious reasons so when that broke and after reading good reviews I went for this one. I am not disappointed at all, works first time, no need to sort cables out and no need to sort out any blockages / starting problems as my neighbour does with his petrol strimmer. Having used one strimmer line I'd suggest getting a decent replacement, I seemed to have used the pattern line from B&Q very quickly, next time I'll use the Black and Decker line and hopefully see and improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Austin

customer_reviews.title: Tidy allotment after all these years!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cut the grass and weeds on my allotment. It’s so easy to carry up there and use - sufficiently light for this 69 year old woman. I am thrilled with how effective it is, even on the eco mode, and my patch now looks unusually tidy. Battery recharges quickly and spool regulates the cutting cord. It really is a pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.author: ruth

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and works beautifully. Used again yesterday to strim around edge of patio and base of hedge. Went through tough Cow Parsley, Alexanders, Dock etc that had found their way into the patch without any trouble. Light enough to use and not be tiring, easy to clean after use, battery charges rapidly and holds a charge well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great strimmer, great price, great features
customer_reviews.text: Bought at the offer price and very impressed. Have two decent size lawns and it handled them no problem. Super easy to set up with one screw to put in. Light, easy to adjust and the adjustable power is also a brilliant touch. Having looked at a huge number of strimmers prior to purchase, I’m very glad I bought this one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great to use but breaks down too easily
customer_reviews.text: Great to use but on our third one as it breaks down too easily. Drive cogs wear out, grass gets underneath the line, REALLY difficult to take apart, awkward to get repairs, spares don't work etc. The reason we bought a third one is it's powerful enough to deal with our 3/4 acre of wild terrain, it's light enough for my wife to use it whenever she wants, and we already had 3 lithium batteries. Would be five stars but loses one for breaking down too often and having a "caveat" in the repairs section saying damage caused by foreign objects (like grass) invalidate the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is great, I can really recommend it
customer_reviews.text: This is great, I can really recommend it. I have had loads of strimmers, so I think my review is worthy. The battery lasts for around 3/4 an hour,is easy to charge up then off we go again, and that is giving it a tough test, long grass, thistles, nettles, around trees it can tackle most thing's and it's not too heavy. I have a large country garden and this strimmer is great for tidying up everywhere.The line has never snagged, so know ping back.
customer_reviews.author: biro

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
